intro: Guerkea schumanniana, commonly known as the Schumacher's guerke, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Central and South America, particularly found in regions of Mexico, Guatemala, and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its botanical features make it an important species in tropical ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical research.
